forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely before 5pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 53. West northwest wind 15 to 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 45. South southwest wind 8 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock strikes eight, the skies over Downtown San Francisco wear a heavy veil, pregnant with the promise of rain. The air is a tad cooler, hinting at the high-spirited gusts that will dance through the streets later. A shroud of clouds stretches over the Golden Gate, where sunlight peeks through sporadically, casting a muted glow upon the city’s famed hills and sharp lines of architecture. The day is marked by an impending drizzle, anticipated to wash over the city before the clock strikes five, urging even the most determined souls to seek shelter as the forecast holds a robust 70% chance of precipitation. Later tonight, the rain is set to amplify to a full 100%, with a deeper chill sneaking in as temperatures dip to the mid-forties.

In light of this atmospheric insistence, comfortable layers are recommended: a water-resistant jacket will serve well against the early showers while a breathable scarf could provide necessary warmth as winds pick up. It might not be the day for leisurely strolls by the waterfront, but a cozy nook in a local café or a visit to one of the many galleries could offer a charming alternative, wrapping you in both warmth and culture as the rain tapers off for brief moments. Embrace the cozy indoors, sip on a cherished brew, and watch as the city glistens under the sheen of the coming rain—the very essence of San Francisco in a quiet, contemplative moment.
